text.text:
Overview:

The vulnerability information provided below is an output of Abbott’s Post-Market Vulnerability Management Program. The program covers the identification, risk analysis, and risk treatment of vulnerabilities from multiple sources of vulnerability data, including:

  • Network-based vulnerability scans (where applicable);
  • Penetration Tests;
  • SBOM NVD/CVE analysis;
  • Threat Intelligence/Vulnerability Monitoring;
  • Product Surveillance; and
  • Abbott’s Coordinated Vulnerability Disclosure Program -
    https://www.abbott.com/policies/cybersecurity/cybersecurity-coordinated-product-disclosure.html

 

Key Definitions:

Date Published – Date vulnerability and associated details were added to Abbott’s Customer Portal.

Vulnerability Identifier – If applicable, CVE or Vendor identifier assigned

Initial Risk Score – If populated, score assigned to a given vulnerability per the CVSS 3.0 scoring system. For entries encompassing multiple CVE’s a range will be provided.

Source – From which source the vulnerability was identified.

Status –

  • Pending = Remediation Decision in Progress.
  • Closed = Vulnerability Assessment and Remediation Decision/Action completed.

Vulnerability Assessment Decision (Controlled/Uncontrolled) – Abbott’s assessment of a vulnerability’s risk of patient harm.

Remediation Decision – Action to be taken for a given vulnerability:

  • Patch: the vulnerability will be patched in a future product maintenance release.
  • Remove functionality: the vulnerability affects functionality that is not in use by the product and shall be removed from the product in a future product maintenance release.                                                                                                                                        
  • Configuration Change: a configuration change will be made within the product or supporting component (e.g. firewall) to address the vulnerability. Change will be made in a future product software build
  • LifeCycle: the vulnerability will be addressed in a future software version.
  • No Action Required: Abbott has determined no additional action is required to address the vulnerability
  • Not Applicable: a False Positive or a vulnerability that cannot be exploited or reached on the attack chain.                                                            

Remediation Details – Contextual information provided to explain Abbott’s Vulnerability Assessment and Remediation Decisions.

Remediation Date – Planned date for completing remediation of vulnerability required for remediation decisions of: Patch; Remove Functionality, Configuration Change and Lifecycle                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     

Vulnerability Information:                           

Abbott Vulnerability: Alinity ci Accepts Tampered Firmware Updates

Date Published: June 9, 2020

Vulnerability Identifier: N/A

Initial Risk Score (CVSS): 7. 7 - CVSS:3. 0/AV:A/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:N

Source: Pen Test

Status: Pending

Vulnerability Assessment Decision: Controlled

Remediation Decision: Lifecycle

Remediation Details:  Mitigating control (XXX) will be implemented with the next release of software, expected in Q4 2021. To perform a firmware update physical access to device is required along with elevated access rights to the operating system. These authorization levels are currently restricted to Abbott personnel.

 

Third-Party Vulnerability: 2020-08 Cumulative Update for .NET Framework 3.5 and 4.7.2 for Windows 10 Version 1809 for x64 (KB4569776)

Date Published: Aug. 8, 2020

Vulnerability Identifier: Microsoft KB4569776 (CVE-2020-1046, CVE-2020-1476)

Initial Risk Score (CVSS): 7.8 – 5.5

Source: Vulnerability Scan

Status: Pending

Vulnerability Assessment Decision: Controlled

Remediation Decision: Patch

Remediation Details:  Microsoft Windows Updates will be evaluated for inclusion in the next release expected in Q4 2021. Whitelisting (Embedded Control) security solution resident on the Alinity ci product prevents execution of unknown code.

 

Third-Party Vulnerability: 2020-12 Cumulative Update for Windows 10 Version 1809 for x64-based Systems (KB4592440)

Date Published: Dec. 08, 2020

Vulnerability Identifier: Microsoft 4592440 (Multiple CVEs)

Initial Risk Score (CVSS): 9.9 – 2.1

Source: Vulnerability Scan

Status: Pending

Vulnerability Assessment Decision: Controlled

Remediation Decision: Patch

Remediation Details:  Microsoft Windows Updates will be evaluated for inclusion in the next release expected in Q4 2021. Whitelisting (Embedded Control) security solution resident on the Alinity ci product prevents execution of unknown code.
